channel.title: Github on NandoTech

item.title: Happy Halloween!
item.author: info@nandotech.com (Fernando Rodriguez)
item.description: It has been a little while since our last post, and though I am currently working on a long awesome post that should help out a ton of people (about halfway done), it was feeling lonely and quiet over here. So, without any further adieu: Octocat Pumpkin carved with <3 by NandoTech’s VP of Technology @ArronMayers in honor of the GitHub Octocat GitHub Halloween Pumpkin In case you’re wondering, the upcoming post will cover Building an API with .

item.title: Getting Started with AngularJS 1.x
item.author: info@nandotech.com (Fernando Rodriguez)
item.description: I recently took the Pluralsight course AngularJS: Get Started by Scott Allen. If you want the tl;dr early, it’s totally worth it and really starts to give you a pretty decent working knowledge of AngularJS, and what’s better yet: you build an actual working application in the process. I did my own tweaks with the UI, minor deviations as well as selecting my own theme, but otherwise it’s pretty cool to see just how easy it is to create beautiful AngularJS apps tied to an API that turns standard JSON responses with little heavy lifting.
